titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Picturing Activism student projects, 2017 RL.11659
titlestmt.author: Paula Jeannet

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-11-13 14:18:54 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection consists of seven creative projects produced by students in the class "Picturing Activism," taught by Lisa McCarty in Fall 2017 at Duke University. The projects utilize archival and contemporary photographs, narrative, poetry, illustrations, digital documents, posters, and oral history interviews in digital audio format to explore themes related to activism, cultural experiences, and visual culture. Subjects include murals in Durham, N.C.; activism in Alamance County, N.C.; African American women, racism, and political activism; environmental crises and activism through photography; pit bull rescues and animal rights; and Chinese cooking as cultural expression. Some of the archival photographs are from the Rubenstein Library's collections. Aquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by student last name.

bioghist.head: HIstorical Note
bioghist.p: Affiliated with the Duke University Liberal Studies Program, the course, Picturing Activism, was taught by Lisa McCarty in Fall 2017. The students explored how images have been intentionally composed, collected, and deployed to serve as catalysts for social and political change.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Images may only be used for educational, non-commercial purposes; any other use requires the photographer's permission.
Electronic formats are open for research. Original media such as optical discs are closed to use; digital files are available.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Picturing Activism student projects were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2018.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Picturing Activism student projects, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The project publications have a variety of gatherings and bindings, including paperback, looseleaf album, and spiral-bound. Most are inkjet printed.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed and encoded by Paula Jeannet, August 2018.
Accession(s) represented in this collection guide: 2018-0087.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Adobe Acrobat .pdf documents contain copies of the contents of the photobook; one is the full version; the other is a shorter version for a class presentation.
